active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the ethical boundaries of using Cobalt Strike Beacon in red team exercises versus its abuse by threat actors. How do Malleable C2 profiles blur the line between legitimate simulation and malicious activity? Support your views with real-world examples from threat intelligence reports.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert cybersecurity educator and flashcard generator specializing in threat intelligence. Generate 30 high-quality flashcards on 'Cobalt Strike Beacon Usage' (Category: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > Threat Intelligence Types > 007_Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs) > Procedures and Implementation). Incorporate these pedagogical elements: - Bloom's Taxonomy objectives: [insert full list from learning_objectives]. - Scaffolding layers: [insert full scaffolding details]. Ensure even coverage across layers. - Voter priorities: Complete stageless beacons (single shellcode, no stager), expand payload variants (reflective DLLs), protocols (HTTP/DNS/SMB), detection/hunting (IOCs, SIEM queries), Malleable C2. - Active learning tie-ins: Cards should support discussions (e.g., evasion ethics), peer teaching (components), problem-solving (PCAP analysis). - Prior knowledge: MITRE TA0002/T1071, networking basics. - Research context: Beacon as C2 implant; Team Server; post-exploitation; sources like vectra.ai, cynet.com. Use exact flashcard schema: Output ONLY a JSON array of 30 objects with fields: front, back, type, bloom_level, layer, explanation, distractors (array or null for non-MCQ). Follow distractor protocol strictly. Mix card types for active recall. Ensure educational depth for threat hunters: Include IOCs, mitigations, real-world evasion. Cards must promote reflection and error correction.
